text: Angelo Mosca (February 13, 1937 â€“ November 6, 2021) was an American Canadian Football League player and professional wrestler. He was also known by the wrestling nicknames King Kong Mosca and The Mighty Hercules. He wrestled for Stampede Wrestling, American Wrestling Association (AWA), and World Wrestling Federation (WWF). He was elected to the Canadian Football Hall of Fame in 1987, the Hamilton Sports Hall of Fame in 2012, and the Ontario Sports Hall of Fame in 2013. Mosca's career lasted from 1958 until 1972. He played for Hamilton Tiger-Cats, Ottawa Rough Riders and Montreal Alouettes. Mosca died on November 6, 2021 from problems caused by Alzheimer's disease, aged 84.Angelo Mosca dead at 84 ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American football players Category:American professional wrestlers Category:Canadian professional wrestlers Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Hamilton Tiger-Cats players Category:Montreal Alouettes players Category:Ottawa Rough Riders players Category:People in the Canadian Football Hall of Fame Category:Professional wrestling announcers Category:Professional wrestling executives Category:Professional wrestling managers and valets Category:Sportspeople from Massachusetts
title: Angelo Mosca
